algorithm_technique: Sorting and Grouping based on swapability
problem_summary_simple: Find the lexicographically smallest array by swapping elements if their difference is within a limit.
problem_summary_technical: Group indices based on the ability to swap elements within a limit. Sort elements within each group and assign them back to the sorted indices.
key_insights: The swap operation defines connected components of indices where elements can be freely rearranged.
Elements within a connected component can be sorted and placed into the sorted positions of that component.
Sorting the original array and then grouping indices based on the limit helps identify these components.
